criterion: Mentions hepatitis B vaccine booster shots are only necessary for individuals who have not received the full series of hepatitis B vaccinations as children.
Provides information about hepatitis B vaccine booster shots without addressing the importance of completing the full series of vaccinations as children.
Correctly explains that hepatitis B vaccine booster shots are typically recommended for adults who were not vaccinated as children or who have a weakened immune system.
Does not mention the potential risks of not getting a hepatitis B vaccine booster shot, such as increased risk of infection.
Mentions that hepatitis B vaccine booster shots are available over-the-counter (OTC) when they are typically prescription-only.
Correctly explains that hepatitis B vaccine booster shots are typically administered by a healthcare provider.
Does not provide any information about the importance of getting a hepatitis B vaccine booster shot if an individual has already had hepatitis B infection.
